ASB - tell us where, when, how exposed.shortDescription: To process your disability claim for asbestos exposure, we need a bit more information from you.
supportAliases: ASB - tell us where, when, how exposed

blocks.content: To process your disability claim for asbestos exposure, we need a bit more information from you.
Please answer the following questions:

items: Where were you exposed to asbestos? (Include your unit, rank, and location if you remember.)
Were any other service members with you? (Please share their names if you can.)
Were you exposed to anything else that may cause cancer (like cigarettes or chemicals) during or after your service?
What jobs did you have before and after your military service? How long did you work at each one?

Request Service Treatment Records from V.shortDescription: We need certified copies of your service treatment records if you have them.
supportAliases: Request Service Treatment Records from Veteran

blocks.content: For your benefits claim, we need certified copies of your service treatment records if you have them. Uploading your copies may speed up the claim review process.

In case you don’t have them, we also requested your service treatment records from the Department of Defense, reserve unit, or national guard unit. You don’t need to request your service treatment records yourself.
Once we have your service treatment records we can schedule an exam.

Submit buddy statement(s).shortDescription: We need statements from people who know about your condition.

blocks.content: For your disability benefits claim, we need statements from people who know about your condition. These are often called "buddy statements."
These people should:

items: Describe what they saw or know about your condition
Include when and where they observed it, and what was happening at the time
Say clearly if they witnessed the event that caused your condition
If they served with you, include their name, rank, and unit at the time

blocks.content: Each person must include the following sentence at the end of their statement:
"I hereby certify that this information is true and correct to the best of my knowledge and belief."
Use VA Form 21-10210 to submit a Lay/Witness Statement (also known as "buddy statements") from someone who knows about your condition and can support your claim.

content: You can submit the completed form online, or you can upload or mail it.
